Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using OOP?

3: a) Defining a method with the same name in a different class.
b) Redefining a method in a subclass with the same signature as the method in the superclass.
c) Hiding a method from the superclass in a subclass.
d) Calling a method from a superclass within a subclass.
4: a) The ability of an object to take on many forms.
b) The process of hiding data within a class.
c) The ability of a class to inherit from multiple classes.
d) The process of creating new classes from existing classes.
5: a) A class that cannot be instantiated.
b) A class that has only abstract methods.
c) A class that is used to represent a real-world object.
6: a) A class that defines the behavior of other classes.
b) A blueprint for classes that specifies what methods a class must implement.
c) A way to create multiple inheritance.
7: a) A special method used to destroy an object.
b) A special method used to create an object.
c) A method used to copy an object.
d) A method used to compare objects.
8: a) Public members are accessible from anywhere, while private members are only accessible within the class.
b) Private members are accessible from anywhere, while public members are only accessible within the class.
c) There is no difference between public and private access modifiers.
d) Public members are faster than private members.
9: a) Protecting data from unauthorized access.
c) Displaying data in a user-friendly way.
